title: What is the most influential book, novel, speech, or essay, of all time? (Besides the Bible) - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A. Besides the Bible the most influential book, novel, speech or essay, is, I would argue, “The Sayings of Chairman Mao”. It was almost mandatory to own and quote from it during the most murderous years of that monster’s rule and it continued to cast its evil pall over a billion-strong world power after Mao’s death. I’m not sure to what extent it’s still considered a vade mecum in China.
The Quaran is a legitimate contender, and I say that as a Catholic. The Confessions of Saint Augustine should be in the top 3 or top 5.
